title: IHOP parent reports revenue miss, lowers guidance
text: Dine Brands Inc. DIN, +1.99%, whose portfolio of restaurant brands includes IHOP and Applebee's, reported third quarter net income of $23.1 million, or $1.36 per share, up from $23.6 million, or $1.29 per share, last year. Adjusted EPS of $1.55 beat the FactSet consensus for $1.53. Revenue $217.4 million was up from $194.1 million last year but below the $224.0 million FactSet guidance. Same-store sales at IHOP grew 0.03% while there was a 1.6% decline at Applebee's. For 2019, Dine Brands expects Applebee's same-store sales to be in the range of flat to down 1% versus previous guidance for a range of flat to down 1.5%. IHOP same-store sales are expected to grow in the range of 1% to 2%. EPS is expected to be in the range of $5.70 to $5.95 down from previous guidance for $5.75 to $6.00. Adjusted EPS is expected to be in the range of $6.75 to $7.00, down from previous guidance of $6.80 to $7.05. The FactSet outlook is for EPS of $6.91. Dine Brands stock is up 8.6% for 2019 so far, but down 8.2% for the past year. The S&P 500 index SPX, -0.08% is up 13.2% for the last 12 months.
